Title: Smooth curve of B-spline with ordo K or Node K
Affiliations: Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gazali, W., Mathematics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Santoso, D., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The background of this research is an early stage of the use of Spline Art graph theory, namely in the construction techniques of objects that will be required or used in the design model of objects / car / aircraft and other construction. There are two basic objectives for the use, which are first to facilitate and deepen the basic knowledge of polynom spline art principles by understanding the correct use of the polynom spline art formula. The second mastery of this theme is the need to produce a graphical system, which is based on the polynom spline art formula. The use of polynom spline art is a large number in the field of construction of object graphs. This Research takes into account the node K of the B-spline blending function. The method used is based on the polynom spline-art theory. The results to be achieved, namely the model of making objects based on polynom spline Art. In this research using programming language to describe and achieve the goal, that is graph by using simple openGL and make in general and can recordthe structure of good data. © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Graphical system; OpenGL; Polynom spline art
Index Keywords: Application programming interfaces (API); Blending; Electronic commerce; Graph theory; Blending function; Construction technique; Design modeling; Graphical system; Object graphs; OpenGL; Polynom spline art; Smooth curves; Interpolation

Title: The Benefits of Bezier, B-Spline Algorithm in the Industry World
Source title: Lecture Notes in Engineering and Computer Science
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santoso, D., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Gazali, W., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Computer Graphic has many applications in various fields such as industries, corporates, banking, and healthcare (hospital). Advanced computer graphic with latest technologies are widely used in strategic industries like aviation, marine, and automotive for solving issues related to images. Using similar methodologies, image analysis can be done to produce more accurate results with better quality (for example CAD or CAM) which will be useful for doctors and patients in hospitals, architects and civil engineers, or other decision makers. The objective of this research is to combine algorithms to produce accurate images with better quality which can be used for decision making based on selected curve. This is performed by associating the Hermite, Bezier, and B-Spline algorithms to its harmonic functions so that the resulting curves / images becomes better and well formed. This research will produce a picture/image/shape that will serve the needs of the designers.
Author Keywords: Algorithms; CAD / CAM; Computer Graphics; Curves; Harmonic functions; Image analysis; Images
Index Keywords: Algorithms; Computer aided design; Computer graphics; Decision making; Engineers; Harmonic functions; Hospitals; Interpolation; Medical computing; Quality control; Splines; B splines; Cad/cams; Corporates; Curves; Decision makers; Hermite; Images; Latest technology; Image analysis

Title: Design model to create a simple computer language
Source title: Far East Journal of Mathematical Sciences
Affiliations: Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl K. H.Synhdan No 9, Kemanggsian, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rasjid, Z.E., Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl K. H.Synhdan No 9, Kemanggsian, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Santoso, D., Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl K. H.Synhdan No 9, Kemanggsian, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: With the use of formal language theory in an initial stage and the decomposition of a sentence in the background, we discuss compiler constructions techniques. The purpose of the paper is two-fold. First, to facilitate and deepen the knowledge of basic principles of compiler along with understanding the correct usage of a programming language. Second, to provide mastery over this theme based on the instructions in a simple and easy language with Indonesia syntax. © 2016 Pushpa Publishing House, Allahabad, India.

Title: The benefits of bezier, B-spline algorithm in the industry world
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santoso, D., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Computer Graphics is a science which is widely used in all fields, especially in the fied of Industries, companies, banking and even hospitals. In the aviation industries, marines and automotves, computer graphics with its latest technologies, can be used to solve graphical or imaging problems. Wherever images is involved, for eaxmple for patients' need in the hospitals, shipping engineers/designers or decision makers in an industry, the images can be analyzed in order to produce a better image in which the accuracy being continuously being researched. (CAD or CAM) (Newman and Sproull, 1981; Date, 1990; Pressman, 2001). The objective of this research is to combine the algorithms in order to create an image which is accurate and can be used by decision makers accordingly. This is performed by associating the Hermite, Bezier, B-Spline algorithms to its harmonic functions such that the resulting curves/images becomes better and more well-formed. This research will produce a picture/image/shape that will serve the needs of the designers. (Newman and Sproull, 1981; Connolly and Begg, 2002; Ramez et al., 2000; Date, 1990; Pressman, 2001). © 2015 The Djunaidy Santoso.

Title: Transformation box-cox for stabilisation of diversity in group random design
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sylvia, Y., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Santoso, D., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: In the field of research, there are a variety of statistical methods used. Hypothesis testing is one test that is often used to obtain the conclusions of the research conducted. One hypothesis testing that is often used is the testing of hypotheses through ANOVA (Box et al., 1978). However, in determining the validity of a hypothesis is obtained, there are assumptions that must be met, namely the assumption of homogeneity range between treatments (Box et al., 1978; Box and Cox, 1964; Gomez and Gomez, 1984; Guerrero, 1993; Mattjik and Made, 2006). Examination of a wide homogeneity assumption has been made in research involving plants, which use a randomized block design. Wide homogeneity assumption was tested using Bartlett test, but from the tests that have been done show no results were less consistent (Box et al., 1978; Box and Cox, 1964; Gomez and Gomez, 1984; Guerrero, 1993; Mattjik and Made, 2006). Transformation Box-Cox used to transform data that is not homogeneous (Box et al., 1978; Box and Cox, 1964). Calculation of the variance range and test computer-based transformation has been compiled using C # programming language. © 2015 The Yenny Sylvia and Djunaidy Santoso.
Author Keywords: ANOVA; Assumption of homogeneity of variance; Randomized block design (RAK); Test bartlett; Transformation box-cox
References: Box, G.E.P., Hunter, W.G., Hunter, J.S., (1978) Statistics for experimenters: An Introduction to Design, Data Analysis and Model Building, p. 653. , 1st Edn., Wiley, New York; Box, G.E.P., Cox, D.R., An analysis of transformations (1964) J. Royal Stat. Abstract: In the manufacture of the CPU need the knowledge about the functions of the CPU components used for the design the CPU. In this case, the control unit is required with a simple method of microprogramming. Microprogramming is used to create the microprogram in binary number that is used to control the CPU and Pin's of components outside the CPU. Controller models in general are digital systems and microprocessor. © 2014 Pushpa Publishing House.

Title: Design optimization of distribution program application construction work on the auditorium search by taboo Anzen Dezine
Source title: Far East Journal of Mathematical Sciences
Affiliations: Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sugito, H., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Santoso, D., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: CV Anzen Dezine is a contractor company in Indonesia and is able to do various types of development. In addition to receiving the construction of the auditorium, they also receive other types of development such as school, shop, shopping, and more. Workers are hired workers from outside this office because of the limitations of existing workers in this office. Therefore, they often slow down the construction work with a variety of reasons in order to obtain a larger payment. Also, at the applicant’s development proposal development inaccurate data provided to the applicant’s development, because the calculation is still based on a rough estimate only. The purpose of this thesis is to design a scheduling application program development using the theory of algorithms auditorium taboo search. Program design is done by applying the algorithm to create optimal work schedules through a mathematical approach. Through scheduling, we can calculate the cost of labor required. So that it can calculate the total cost required for development. The method used is the method of analysis and design. After implementation in the existing system, it can be concluded that the application of taboo search algorithm in scheduling the construction of the auditorium can assist decision-making and scheduling to win a development proposal to the applicant building. © 2014 Pushpa Publishing House, Allahabad, India.
Author Keywords: Application; Cost; Development; Scheduling; Taboo search
References: Alexandrescu, A., (2001) Modern C++ Design: Generic Programming and Design Patterns Applied, , Addison-Wesley; Glover, F., Taboo Search: A Tutorial., , http://www.cse.unt.edu/~garlick/teaching/4310/assign/TS%20-%20Tutorial.pdf, Last Access: June 26, 2011; Munir, R., (2010) Discrete Mathematics, , Informatics Bandung; Pressman, R.S., (2010) Software Engineering: A Practitioner's Approach, , 7th ed., McGraw Hill; Rahardja, W., (2006) Design Patterns Application Program Optimization Laying in Field with Taboo Search Method, , Information Engineering - Mathematics, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta; Kelvin, R., (2008) Comparison of Genetic Algorithm and Taboo Search for the Traveling Salesman Problem Resolution, , Information Engineering - Mathematics, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta; Zachariasen, M., Dam, M., (1995) Taboo Search on the Geometric Traveling Salesman Problem, , Department of Computer Science (Diku), University of Copenhagen; Anonymous, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/building, webpage; http://kamus.sabda.org/kamus/penjadwalan

Authors: Meilisa S., Im Manik N., Santoso D.
Title: Testing deterministic finite automata and non-deterministic finite automata using Java program
Source title: Far East Journal of Mathematical Sciences
Affiliations: Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Meilisa, S., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta 11530, Indonesia; Im Manik, N., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta 11530, Indonesia; Santoso, D., Mathematics and Statistics Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: We have tested the transition diagram of deterministic finite automata (DFA) and non-deterministic finite automata (NFA) using a computer software of Java programming language. This application is able to describe the transition diagram of DFA and NFA. It is able to determine which string inputted from the user can be accepted or rejected. The main goal is to help facilitate language learning automata theory. This research describes the system development of the application program, from the creating of automata structures to the implementation of algorithm in the creation and running of automata transformation. The test is conducted by observing the system in dealing with the formation and transformation of finite automata. It is conducted to examine the system's ability to run automata in large state. From the test we obtain that the system is capable of creating automata and performing transformations between finite automata. The results of performance testing show that the system is able to run the creation and transformation of finite state automata up to 1000 states. © 2013 Pushpa Publishing House, Allahabad, India.
Author Keywords: DFA; Eclipse; Finite state automata; NFA

Title: Designing application programs sheet music using fast fourier transform method
Source title: IMECS 2011 - International MultiConference of Engineers and Computer Scientists 2011
Affiliations: Mathematics Department, Faculty of Science and Technology, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Faculty of Computer Studies, BlNUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gazali, W., Mathematics Department, Faculty of Science and Technology, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Santoso, D., Computer Science Department, Faculty of Computer Studies, BlNUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: A good singer is demanded not only for singing well, but he/she also must be able to master the song soulfully. Unfortunately, most of musical creations are written in music block notations. This is quite troublesome for Indonesian singers because students are used to use sheet music written in cipher notations or numbered musical notations. Therefore, authors intend to make an application program that can solve this problem. There are many methods which can be used in making the voice-related applications. The method used by author is the Fast Fourier Transform method which will transform digital signals into analog signals. Application program created by author is expected to help singers to master the songs, specially in terms of tone and pitch intervals.
Author Keywords: Block notation; Fast fourier transform; Sheet music; Tone
Index Keywords: Analog signals; Application programs; Block notation; Digital signals; Fourier transform method; Musical notation; Sheet music; Tone; Computer science; Engineers; Fast Fourier transforms
